fields.title: DoseMatic
fields.short: Continuing working on the DoseMatic project. Created module for statistical analysis of acute, protracted and partial doses of radiation detected in blood samples. Additional statistical tools include: calibration function comparison and report generation. Project is almost ready for testing.
fields.place: Institute of Theoretical Physics, University of Wrocław

fields.title: Critical Point and Onset of Defonfinement 2017
fields.short: Presentation of newly obtained preliminary results on kaons produced in Ar+Sc collisions: "Identified hadron production in Ar+Sc collisions at SPS energies". No horn structure in kaon production with dependence on the collision energy is observed.

I took part in the organization as well.

fields.short: Workshop aimed to look deeply into the data on Ar+Sc collisions. The list of event and track cuts were developed and discussed. First look at analysis of the spectra of produced negatively charged hadrons.

fields.title: Master thesis defense
fields.short: Thesis title: “Pulser Calibration of Time Projection Chambers in the NA61/SHINE”.
fields.body: The thesis covers the overview of NA61/SHINE strong interactions programme and describes a method of TPC read-out synchronization calibration with a pulser. The results were presented and studies for potential signals of detector ageing.
fields.place: Institute of Theoretical Physics, University of Wrocław

Accepted: March 25 2015,  Published: June 29 2015.

fields.title: Student’s Nobel – best student in science (regional level)

fields.title: Lectures for Childrens’ University
fields.short: I have given four classes for children in the subject of “How to control your house with a microcomputer?”.
fields.body:
Together with Michał Naskręt and with a great help from dr Janusz Szwabiński I have prepared a 1-hour workshop for children titled: “How to control your house with a microcomputer?”. Children worked on Raspberry Pi computers and its GPIO connectors and successfully created a simple anti-theft system.
All-together we've given four of such classes for about 80 happy children.

fields.title: 2nd prize in Fizbit
fields.short: Physics Popularization Software, titled “Remote Robot Drive”. The DirectX and C# driven racing simulator, with remote controls with an android app (Java).

I gave a presentation titled: “Supercomputer – do it yourself!” and I was awarded an audience prize for the best presentation.

fields.title: DoseMatic – the beginning

fields.title: ICPS Edinburgh
fields.short: My first presentation on International Conference of Physics Students, titled: “Application of distributed computing in Physics”.
fields.body:
Abstract:
In Physics there are just a few problems that  can be solved exactly. One of approaches to the rest of them is to search for numerical solutions. As problems are getting more complex the higher computer performance is needed. Such need may be fulfilled by means of parallel computing, which highly extends the abilities of single processors. Given the fact that multiple CPUs are already being installed in every laptop and smartphone we have a lot of tools to take advantage of. 
In my lecture I will introduce basic implementations of distributed computing, depending on hardware as well as software. I will focus on computer clusters Beowulf type, where as an example will serve a small cluster constructed with my contribution.
As the main part I will also present how supercomputers are used in resolving various scientific problems, including: monte carlo simulations, neural networks and fractals.

fields.title: Internship at Rhino Sp. z o. o. (now part of Hicron Group)
fields.short: Time series prediction with Artificial Neural Networks under supervision of Kamil Kucia in Rhino Sp. z o. o.

fields.title: Organization of WkoTP 2013
fields.short: Organization of Winter Kindergarten of Theoretical Physics 2013 in Lądek-Zdrój. I gave a popular-science lecture on string theory.

fields.title: Raspberry Pi Cluster
fields.short: Construction of a computing cluster, consisting of 8 Raspberry Pi units.
fields.body:
Students in many countries have difficulties in access to supercomputer resources. It is difficult for them to learn how to use parallel programming and how to create a HPC architecture. Using ARM based single-board computers can significantly change the situation.
Together with Michał Naskręt we have built an ARM based cluster at the University of Wrocław. Our motivation was to learn the basics of computing cluster administration and to study the methods of parallelization of computing.

fields.title: STM Laboratory
fields.short: Studying the surfaces of Mo(211) with layers of oxygen. Results were presented on ICPS in Budapest by Jakub Kwiecień.
fields.body:
Abstract:
The Mo(211) surface was investigated by the scanning tunneling microscope (STM) and low energy electron diffraction (LEED) methods. Growth of Mo2O layer and the surface structure reconstruction has been observed during an increasing of oxygen atoms concentration on the surface.
fields.place: Institute of Experimental Physics, University of Wrocław

fields.title: NA61/SHINE Collaboration Meeting

fields.title: Exicted QCD
fields.short: I gave an invited speech concerning most recent results “On strangeness in NA61/SHINE”.
fields.body:
Abstract:
NA61/SHINE is a fixed target experiment at the CERN Super-Proton-Synchrotron. The main goals of the experiment are to discover the critical point of strongly interacting matter and to study the properties of the onset of deconfinement. In order to reach these goals, a study of hadron production properties is performed in nucleus-nucleus, proton-proton and proton-nucleus interactions as a function of collision energy and size of the colliding nuclei. 
In this talk, I will review recent results on strangeness production in p+p, Be+Be and Ar+Sc collisions in the SPS energy range. Transverse mass spectra, rapidity spectra and mean multiplicities of kaons obtained with various analysis methods will be presented. An overview of statistical and dynamical models of strangeness production in the vicinity of phase transition will be presented as well. Predictions of the models will be compared with available results on heavy-ions collisions and, most importantly, with new results on intermediate mass systems.

fields.title: Science Picnic (Piknik Naukowy) Copernicus Science Centre
fields.short: Presenting the SHINE3D VR for hundreds of kids and adults during this year's edition of "Piknik Naukowy" by Copernicus Science Centre.
fields.body:
I was a coordinator of IFT's exhibition during the "Science Picnic" organized by the Copernicus Science Centre. The main theme of our stand was the 3D visualization of the NA61/SHINE implemented in Virtual Reality (Oculus) by two bright IT students: Filip Michalski and Taras Palayda.
We estimate couple hundred visitors enjoying our exhibition.
